desc: Students examine the limitations and the enormous potential of film in depicting and interpreting past events in U.S. history. They analyze films using a variety of theoretical models and explore the connection between the present and filmic interpretations of famous past episodes in U.S. history, including the American Revolution, the Civil War, Custer's "Last Stand," and the turbulent events of the 1960s. Writing assignments enable students to demonstrate their analytical skills. Group projects offer the opportunity to write screenplays. Offered periodically. Counts towards American studies major and film studies concentration.
name: Reel Am/History/Film
title: Reel America: U.S. History in Film
